post.body: Big Bowl, Big Bowl, baby
I've heard others who have bumped up against the follow limit, not sure what happened. Ask @SLAMonline for instance.
Those CIA rendition planes don't care what footwear passengers have on, they're going to Syria!
too bad GWB will never fly commercial in his lifetime…
yeah, I just want sensationalism and tales of rock Gods and groupies…
glad you're ok
also, my mom always made lemon cookies, plus a bunch others, varied by year. Adults had a glass of sherry (or two).
Santa presents on Xmas day, unwrapped. Unwrap 1 present on Xmas eve. Stocking mostly candy, some small quirky things.
relieved or disappointed not to be going to E Texas?
geez, hope this is the right diagnosis, and not a continuing House episode
downloading the Felice Brothers album (MP3) on the basis of 1 song. Don't do me wrong, "15 grams of heroin, an ounce of speed" Rockefeller
I really shouldn't be drinking salty dogs on an empty stomach. But kinda too late now. Whoo whoo.
Oh, the anthrax libel lawsuit Hatfill filed… http://bit.ly/42De
So what is the Hatfill libel lawsuit that Nick Kristof is twittering about?
I still run Eudora on 3 of the 6 Macs in day to day use in my office. Inertia and fear of change, and lots of saved email, mostly.
Discovered that my asshole neighbor's dryer/furnace vent goes in our furnace/laundry room, and it leaks. Chicago inspectors strike again.
http://tinyurl.com/5ukg9f I am most definitely a film addict. Film school dropout and all that…
Leopard help viewer wants to load some file on my Yikes G4, two computers ago! Why? What are you fucking looking for! Stop already!
ahh, it was Launchbar 5.beta that was the clipboard culprit. Really fracked me up yesterday.
If Jesus first died in the 20th century, would Catholics be wearing tiny electric chairs on their necks? - Lenny Bruce (paraphrased)
Reading the Uncut Jimmy Page edition, want to read Richard Cole's book about his Led Zeppelin roady days…
Portishead's Third hasn't really done anything for me, now that I think about it.
The Taste of Tea was a very strange, cool movie. Warning, minor plot point about shitting in the woods. Japanese less squeamish about shit.
I've never actually had mead before, is it supposed to be a little sour? The bottle had dust on it, perhaps not of recent vintage.
Good day to drop off food and/or donate cash to a food bank. http://my.barackobama.com/foodbanks
Time Machine backup is failing - not enough room.
One of my cats is nicknamed Stringer Bell, b/c his favorite toy is a piece of string attached to a fishing pole. Apologies to Idris Elba…
April Fools Comes Early: the NYT pulls a Sarah Palin http://bit.ly/64tp
Ambivalent about "Best of xxxx" lists, but having recently added Dylan's Pat Garrett & Billy the Kid to my library, it's a strong contender
Twitter poll: how many have eaten fried twinkies (advertised in this Swank Frank photo http://bit.ly/16XtR ). So far, 1 of you 'fessed up
I always wondered what RAW in camera RAW stood for. Apparently it isn't even an acronym and the capitalization is just *tradition*.
"Museums don’t hang pictures based on how “straight out of the camera” they are." - Peter iNova
Don't forget to thank Einstein for his mathematical work that (eventually) led to digital cameras http://bit.ly/mje7
Boo - Eric Alterman is ceasing "Altercation". Wonder what happened? Did Media Matters kick him out? or what?
I guess Roger Ebert is on Twitter, or nearly http://bit.ly/BEzE
Oh great, jury summons in Austin. I really need to change my D.L. address. I've only lived in Chicago since 1994…
How come Life Magazine/Google doesn't know how to spell Comiskey Park? Though got Al Capone right. http://bit.ly/ZDdX
This kind of subzero weather is fun, for a while, especially if you have a new Wii to play with… http://bit.ly/13dsw
Xmas came early: D opened her Wii, and we played until 1:30 am. Wii sports only, but had fun.
Like Philip K Dick said: "Don’t try to solve serious matters in the middle of the night."
